There are many types of religious morals. The [[monotheistic]] religions, such as [[Islam]], [[Judaism]], [[Christianity]], and to a certain degree others such as [[Sikhism]], define right and wrong by the laws and rules set forth by their respective gods and as interpreted by religious figures within the respective faith. [[Polytheistic]] religious traditions tend to diverge from this path. A wide range of philosophical moral traditions exist; religious moral traditions exist next to secular moral frameworks such as [[humanism]], [[utilitarianism]], and others. There are many types of religious morals. The [[monotheistic]] religions, such as [[Islam]], [[Judaism]], [[Christianity]], and to a certain degree others such as [[Sikhism]], define right and wrong by the laws and rules set forth by their respective gods and as interpreted by religious figures within the respective faith. [[Polytheistic]] religious traditions tend to diverge from this path.
